name: Enterprise Architecture CoE
description: An EA Center of Excellence in a large banking organization.

name: Architecture Governance
description: Establish and enforce architecture standards and policies.

name: Technology Assessment
description: Evaluate and recommend technologies aligned with business goals.

name: Roadmap Development
description: Create and maintain a strategic roadmap for architecture initiatives.

name: Stakeholder Engagement
description: Facilitate communication and collaboration among stakeholders.

name: Capability Maturity Assessment
description: Assess and improve the maturity of architectural practices.

name: Architecture Standards and Policy Lifecycle
description:
Defines and maintains architecture standards, policies, and governance rules to guide solution design, development, and change across the organization. Establishes ownership, approval workflows, and a lifecycle for standards.

Outcomes include consistent architecture conformance, faster decision-making, and traceable policy history aligned to strategic goals.

**Inputs**
- Strategic direction and business goals
- Existing standards library and policy catalog
- Regulatory, risk, and compliance requirements
- Architecture baseline and reference models
- Change requests and project intake

**Outputs**
- Approved and published standards and policies
- Policy lifecycle artifacts (owner, version, retirement date)
- Policy update backlog and decisions
- Conformance readiness for programs/projects

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Architecture Governance Council
- Solutions Architects
- Compliance and Security
- Project/Program Management Office

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- EA Repository
- Policy Management System
- Collaboration/workflow platform

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM
- ISO/IEC 42010
- COBIT 2019

name: Architecture Conformance and Compliance Monitoring
description:
Establishes ongoing monitoring of architecture conformance across programs, identifying deviations and initiating remediation. Delivers dashboards and alerts that enable timely remediation and assurance that architectural standards are upheld.

**Inputs**
- Approved standards and policies
- Architecture runway and reference models
- Program designs and solution patterns
- Audit findings and regulatory requirements
- Change logs and issue tickets

**Outputs**
- Conformance reports and dashboards
- Deviation logs and remediation plans
- Corrective action records and evidence of compliance
- Compliance assurance for program governance

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Architecture Governance Council
- Program Managers and Delivery Leads
- Compliance and Audit

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- GRC platform, monitoring dashboards, EA repository

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ISO/IEC 42010
- COBIT 2019
- NIST SP 800-53

name: Architecture Decision Governance and ADR Management
description:
Govern architecture decision-making by creating, reviewing, and recording Architectural Decisions (ADRs) with rationale, alternatives considered, and impacts. Provides traceability for decisions, supports fast decision cycles, and improves alignment with standards and roadmaps.

**Inputs**
- Architecture standards and policies
- Project proposals and designs
- ADR templates and decision logs
- Stakeholder input and risk considerations

**Outputs**
- ADR records and decision evidence
- Rationale and alternatives documented
- Decision timelines and ownership

**Stakeholders**
- Solution Architects
- Architecture Governance Council
- Project Sponsors and PMO
- Risk and Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- ADR management tool
- Version control or document repository

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM
- IEEE 1028
- ISO/IEC 42010

name: Architecture Change Control and Lifecycle Gatekeeping
description:
Manages architecture-related change requests across projects; defines approval gates, impact assessment, and change prioritization. Ensures controlled changes with traceability and alignment to architecture roadmaps.

**Inputs**
- Change requests, architecture runway, backlog, risk assessments
- Roadmap and program plans
- Impact assessments and stakeholder inputs

**Outputs**
- Approved changes, change logs, updated roadmaps
- Change impact records and remediation actions
- Updated governance artifacts

**Stakeholders**
- Governance Council
- Solution Architects
- PMO
- Security and Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Workflow and change-management tool
- Collaboration platform

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ITIL
- TOGAF
- COBIT

name: Architecture Knowledge, Patterns, and Reference Architecture Management
description:
Maintains catalog of reference architectures, patterns, and decision rationales to accelerate design and ensure consistency. Enables reuse, reduces rework, and improves scalability across delivery teams.

**Inputs**
- Reference models and pattern catalog
- Lessons learned and roadmaps
- Current projects and solution designs

**Outputs**
- Architecture patterns library
- Reference architectures and usage guidance
- Updated design artifacts and reuse recommendations

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Architects
- Delivery teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Knowledge base / repository
- Documentation tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ISO/IEC 42010
- TOGAF

name: Technology Landscape Discovery and Alignment
description:
Identify current and emerging technologies with relevance to business goals, map them to key business capabilities, and establish a baseline of capabilities and gaps.

Produce an actionable view of where technology can enable value, with alignment to strategic priorities and measurable outcomes.

**Inputs**
- Business strategy and priorities
- Current technology inventory and architectural artifacts
- Capability maps and process descriptions
- Market signals and vendor landscape
- Constraints (budget, risk appetite)

**Outputs**
- Technology landscape report
- Capability-aligned technology opportunities map
- Recommended initial focus areas with rationale

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture
- CIO Office / Technology Strategy
- Business Unit Leaders
- PMO / Portfolio Management
- Information Security

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Technology scouting platforms
- Market intelligence dashboards
- Data-modeling tools for mapping landscape to capabilities

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM
- ISO/IEC 27001/27002 considerations for security alignment
- NIST Cybersecurity Framework

name: Evaluation Framework and Scoring Methodology
description:
Define objective, criteria, and scoring approach to evaluate technology options against business goals.

Provide a transparent, repeatable method to compare options, enabling informed recommendations and consistent governance.

**Inputs**
- Business goals and success metrics
- Technology landscape outputs
- Prior evaluation results (if any)
- Risk appetite and policy constraints

**Outputs**
- Evaluation framework document
- Scoring model with weights
- Option ranking and rationale

**Stakeholders**
- Architecture Review Board
- Portfolio Management
- Business Leaders
- Security and Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- decision analytics software
- scoring templates

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ITIL/COBIT alignment
- TOGAF governance artifacts
- ISO 31000 risk management

name: Technology Vendor and Solution Evaluation
description:
Assess vendor viability, fit, and solution capabilities against evaluation framework; manage vendor demos, reference checks.

Deliver recommended shortlists and vendor-specific mitigations aligned to business priorities.

**Inputs**
- Landscape and evaluation framework
- RFP/RFI responses
- Vendor demonstrations and reference checks
- Technical and security requirements

**Outputs**
- Shortlist of preferred vendors/solutions
- Vendor assessment reports
- Risk and mitigation notes per vendor

**Stakeholders**
- Procurement
- Legal and Compliance
- Architecture
- Business Sponsors

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Vendor risk assessment tools
- Demo scheduling and evaluation templates

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- SaaS/On-Prem evaluation standards
- NIST SP 800-53 mapping for vendor security controls

name: Risk, Compliance, and Security Assessment
description:
Identify and assess risk posture, regulatory compliance, data protection and security implications of technology choices.

Produce risk mitigations and align technology options with organizational risk appetite and policy.

**Inputs**
- Regulatory requirements
- Selected landscape options
- Security standards and policies
- Data classification information

**Outputs**
- Risk register and risk rating per option
- Security/compliance recommendations
- Mitigation plans and residual risk notes

**Stakeholders**
- Chief Information Security Officer
- Security, Privacy, Compliance
- Legal
- Architecture

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- risk assessment tools
- security policy catalogs

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- NIST Cybersecurity Framework
- ISO 27001/27002
- GDPR/CCPA where applicable

name: Recommendation Synthesis and Business Case
description:
Integrate findings into a clear, decision-ready recommendation with business case, cost estimates, and implementation considerations.

Provide inputs to Roadmap Development and ensure alignment with strategic priorities.

**Inputs**
- All prior sub-capability outputs
- Business priorities and budgets
- Implementation feasibility data

**Outputs**
- Final technology recommendation and rationale
- Business case including ROI and TCO
- Implementation considerations and high-level roadmap inputs

**Stakeholders**
- Executive Steering Committee
- CFO / Finance
- CIO
- Business Owners

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- business case templates
- financial modeling tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK or PMI standards for project valuation
- ISO 55001 asset management alignment
- COBIT for governance alignment

name: Strategy and Scope Definition for Architecture Roadmap
description:
Define the strategic intent, scope, and target-state architecture to be realized by the roadmap; align with business strategy, risk appetite, and regulatory considerations to bound planning and decision-making.

Outcomes include a prioritized initiative portfolio, approved success criteria, and artifacts that translate strategy into a tangible, executable roadmap aligned with business goals.

**Inputs**
- Business strategy and goals
- Current architecture baseline
- Stakeholder requirements and input
- Budget and capacity constraints
- Architectural principles and standards

**Outputs**
- Roadmap strategy and scope document
- Target-state architecture and initiative backlog
- Prioritized backlog with rationale
- Roadmap artifacts (timeline, milestones)

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- CIO/CTO
- Portfolio/PMO
- Business Unit Leaders
- Strategy and Planning Office

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Roadmapping and portfolio management tools
- Collaboration platform for planning and alignment

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF: Architecture Vision and Preliminary phases
- ISO/IEC 42010: Architecture descriptions

name: Initiative Portfolio Prioritization and Sequencing
description:
Establish a criteria-driven process to evaluate and rank architectural initiatives by value, risk, urgency, dependencies, and capacity; define prioritization rules and sequencing logic to guide the roadmap.

Outcomes include a validated, prioritized backlog with justification, sequencing plan, and traceability to business outcomes and strategic goals.

**Inputs**
- Initiative proposals and business cases
- Value metrics and KPIs
- Risk assessments
- Capacity and resource data
- Dependency map

**Outputs**
- Prioritized backlog
- Sequencing plan and milestones
- Rationale and decision records
- Updated roadmap view

**Stakeholders**
- EA team
- PMO
- Business Owners
- Finance
- Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Portfolio management tool
- Scenario planning and what-if analysis tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM (Phases A, B, C)
- SAFe alignment or PRINCE2 context

name: Roadmap Financial and Resource Planning
description:
Forecast and secure funding and resources across time horizons; translate strategic intent into budgetary plans for architecture initiatives.

Outcomes include an integrated costed roadmap, resource capacity plan, and funding approvals that enable disciplined delivery and governance.

**Inputs**
- Budget envelopes and funding policies
- Initiative cost estimates
- Resource availability and skill mappings
- Vendor/contracts
- Financial governance policies

**Outputs**
- Costed roadmap
- Resource plan and capacity forecast
- Funding requests and approvals
- Financial metrics linked to roadmap

**Stakeholders**
- Chief Financial Officer
- PMO / Portfolio Manager
- Enterprise Architecture
- Project Managers
- Procurement

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Financial planning software
- ERP/PPM integration

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- COA alignment; GAAP; IT financial management best practices

name: Dependency Mapping and Sequencing
description:
Identify cross-initiative dependencies, constraints, and critical paths; codify sequencing logic to support feasible, risk-aware rollout.

Outcomes include a dependency graph, sequencing rules, and mitigation actions that improve integration and delivery predictability.

**Inputs**
- Dependency data from initiatives
- Architectural constraints
- External dependencies
- Integration interfaces and APIs

**Outputs**
- Dependency graph
- Sequencing plan and critical path
- Dependency risk mitigations

**Stakeholders**
- EA team
- Solution Architects
- Integration/DevOps teams
- PMO

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Dependency mapping/visualization tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM: Architecture Vision, Implementation and Migration Plan
- PRINCE2 or PMBOK integration

name: Roadmap Governance, Review, and Change Control
description:
Define governance cadence, review cycles, approvals, and change control processes for the roadmap; ensure alignment with strategic intent and regulatory requirements.

Outcomes include formalized governance, traceability of changes, timely approvals, and ongoing alignment with business priorities.

**Inputs**
- Governance policies and change control templates
- Stakeholder calendars
- Regulatory and compliance requirements

**Outputs**
- Roadmap change log
- Approved roadmap versions
- Decision records

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture Governance Board
- CIO/CTO
- PMO
- Business Owners
- Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Collaboration/workflow tools
- Document management/version control

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM: Architecture Governance
- IT governance frameworks (e.g., COBIT)

name: Stakeholder Identification and Segmentation
description:
Identify and categorize all stakeholders who influence or are affected by EA initiatives, capturing roles, interests, influence, and concerns to support targeted engagement and governance.

Deliver a clear stakeholder map and segmentation that informs engagement planning, risk assessment, and decision rights, aligning with Stakeholder Engagement goals within the EA CoE.

**Inputs**
- Business strategy and objectives
- EA program scope
- Existing stakeholder lists and contact data
- Governance structures and decision rights
- Risk and regulatory considerations

**Outputs**
- Stakeholder map
- Segmentation profiles (influence, interest, impact)
- Engagement triggers by segment
- Updated contact channels

**Stakeholders**
- EA CoE team
- Business unit owners
- PMO/Project leads
- Compliance and risk teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Stakeholder mapping software
- CRM/Contact Management
- Survey and data collection tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMI PMBOK Stakeholder Management
- PRINCE2 Stakeholder Engagement guidelines

name: Stakeholder Requirements Elicitation and Validation
description:
Capture and validate stakeholder needs, expectations, and constraints to ensure alignment with business objectives and EA outcomes.

Validated requirements enable informed decision-making, traceability, and prioritized delivery that supports architecture initiatives and strategic roadmaps.

**Inputs**
- Stakeholder maps and segmentation reports
- Strategic goals and business cases
- Current requirements and backlog
- Change requests and regulatory constraints
- Subject matter expert inputs

**Outputs**
- Validated requirements
- Traceability matrix
- Acceptance criteria
- Requirement backlog items

**Stakeholders**
- Business analysts
- Subject matter experts
- Product owners and sponsors
- Governance boards

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Interview and workshop facilitation tools
- Requirement management systems (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Aha)
- Collaboration platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMI PMBOK Requirements Management
- IIBA BABOK Elicitation and Analysis

name: Engagement Planning and Cadence Management
description:
Develop and maintain the engagement plan and cadence across stakeholders to ensure timely, relevant, and transparent interactions aligned with EA roadmaps and governance.

Deliverables include an engagement plan, communications calendar, forum designs, and escalation paths; effective cadence improves alignment and reduces friction, accelerating decision-making.

**Inputs**
- Stakeholder maps, EA roadmaps
- Milestones and change calendars
- Communication policies
- Escalation paths

**Outputs**
- Engagement plan
- Communications calendar
- Meeting agendas and minutes
- Forum designs

**Stakeholders**
- Engagement lead
- Communications team
- PMO and project leads
- Business unit liaisons

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Collaboration platforms (Teams, Slack, etc.)
- Email and calendar tools
- Meeting facilitation tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Communications Management
- PRINCE2 Communications

name: Feedback, Issue and Conflict Resolution Management
description:
Capture stakeholder feedback, surface issues, and manage conflicts to inform decisions and maintain alignment with strategic goals and commitments.

Outputs include an issue log, decision records, and action plans; effective resolution improves responsiveness, trust, and strategy execution.

**Inputs**
- Stakeholder feedback
- Change requests
- Incident/defect reports
- Escalation triggers
- Governance escalation thresholds

**Outputs**
- Issue log
- Decision records
- Action plans
- Escalation notes

**Stakeholders**
- Feedback providers
- Change Control Board
- EA program team
- Sponsors

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Feedback collection tools
- Issue tracking systems
- Collaboration platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Change Management
- ITIL Incident and Conflict Resolution

name: Relationship Governance, Trust Building, and Performance Measurement
description:
Establish ongoing relationship governance with stakeholders, track relationship health, trust, and engagement effectiveness to enable sustainable collaboration.

Outputs include relationship health dashboards, governance review reports, and continuous improvement actions; aligned with EA goals and stakeholder expectations.

**Inputs**
- Engagement history
- Governance policies
- Service level expectations
- Stakeholder satisfaction metrics

**Outputs**
- Relationship health scorecards
- Governance meeting minutes
- Action plans

**Stakeholders**
- Executive sponsors
- Stakeholder representatives
- EA leadership and governance board

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- BI dashboards
- Analytics platforms
- Survey tools for satisfaction

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Stakeholder Management
- Governance frameworks (e.g., ISO 38500) and PRINCE2/PMBOK alignment

name: Maturity Measurement and Benchmarking
description:
Define and execute a standardized maturity measurement model to quantify the current state of architectural practices across the enterprise, collect data from diverse sources, score maturity levels, and benchmark against targets and peers to establish a credible baseline.

Deliver a baseline maturity score, actionable dashboards, and a benchmark narrative that informs target setting, investment decisions, and prioritization of improvement efforts aligned to the Capability Maturity Assessment objective.

**Inputs**
- Architecture practice data sources (policies, standards adoption, reference implementations)
- Stakeholder interviews and surveys
- Existing maturity model and target state definitions
- Enterprise strategy and architectural goals
- Relevant governance and risk requirements

**Outputs**
- Baseline maturity score and domain-level ratings
- Maturity dashboards and reports
- Benchmark and comparison against targets and peers
- Initial gap list aligned to target state
- Recommendations for immediate and strategic actions

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture Leaders
- Architecture Practice Owners (domain architects, solution architects)
- PMO and Portfolio Managers
- CIO Office and senior sponsors
- Business Unit Leaders (as applicable)

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Assessment surveys and dashboards (survey tools, data collection templates)
- Data integration and visualization platforms
- Data quality management tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF Maturity Model
- CMMI (Development/Services) references
- ArchiMate-based capability representations

name: Gap Identification and Remediation Planning
description:
Translate maturity findings into a structured gap analysis across architecture domains, identifying root causes and prioritizing remediation actions based on business impact, risk, and feasibility.

Deliver an actionable remediation plan with clearly owned actions, timelines, resource estimates, and alignment to enterprise roadmaps, enabling rapid progression of architecture practices.

**Inputs**
- Baseline maturity and target state definitions
- Gap analysis templates
- Risk and compliance requirements
- Capacity and budget constraints
- Insights from stakeholder interviews

**Outputs**
- Prioritized remediation backlog with owners and due dates
- Action plans and owner assignments
- Updated risk mitigation measures
- Alignment artifacts to program/portfolio roadmaps

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture Leaders
- Domain/Solution Architects
- PMO and Transformation Office
- Business Unit Leaders

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Backlog management tool (Jira/DevOps)
- Remediation planning templates
- Benefit, cost, risk scoring

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM Gap Analysis
- COBIT 2019 alignment
- ArchiMate-based mapping of gaps to capabilities

name: Maturity Governance, Assurance, and Sustainment
description:
Establish governance for the capability maturity program, including roles, decision rights, review cadences, and assurance processes to sustain progress.

Deliver governance artifacts and regular assurance reports; ensure adherence to standards; drive continuous improvement and alignment with enterprise objectives.

**Inputs**
- Governance charter and policies
- Maturity model and standards documentation
- Review cadence and escalation paths

**Outputs**
- Governance committee charter
- Assurance reports and dashboards
- Continuous improvement backlog
- Compliance and progress metrics

**Stakeholders**
- CoE Governance Board
- Chief Architect
- Compliance/Audit
- Portfolio and Program Leaders
- Business Stakeholders

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Collaboration and reporting platforms
- Issue tracking and workflow tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ISO/IEC 38500
- COBIT 2019
- TOGAF governance practices

name: Architecture Practice Capability Development and Enablement
description:
Design and deliver capability development programs to raise architecture practice maturity, including skills, playbooks, and reference patterns.

Track adoption and progress, improve standardization, and correlate with maturity progression to support ongoing capability uplift.

**Inputs**
- Capability requirements and role profiles
- Current competency data
- Training resources and budget
- Reference architectures and patterns
- Learning assets and communities of practice

**Outputs**
- Training plan and calendar
- Architecture practice playbooks and reference patterns
- Certification paths and onboarding material
- Adoption and progress metrics

**Stakeholders**
- HR / Organizational Development
- Architecture Leaders
- Practice Owners
- Delivery Teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Learning Management System (LMS)
- Knowledge repositories and playbook libraries

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF skills framework
- ISACA guidance on architecture governance and competencies

name: Maturity Data, Metrics, and Reporting Platform
description:
Build and operate a data and analytics platform that collects, validates, and stores metrics necessary for measuring architecture maturity across the enterprise.

Provide reliable dashboards and reports for stakeholders to monitor progress, inform decisions, and demonstrate value of capability maturity initiatives.

**Inputs**
- Data sources (surveys, audits, practice adoption metrics)
- Data definitions and quality rules
- Data governance policies
- Privacy and security considerations
- Stakeholder reporting requirements

**Outputs**
- Central metrics repository
- Dashboards and reports
- Data quality dashboards
- Data lineage and definitions

**Stakeholders**
- Data Office / Chief Data Officer
- Enterprise Architecture
- Finance / PMO
- CIO Office

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- BI platform (e.g., Tableau/Power BI)
- Data catalog and lineage tools
- Data quality tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Data governance standards (DAMA, ISO/IEC 8000)
- COBIT data management practices
- TOGAF Measurement and Metrics guidance
